item.title: Halloween: The Game Officially Announced For 2026
item.content:encoded:
Halloween, the game based on John Carpenter’s classic Halloween movie franchise, has been officially revealed.

In development in a collaborative effort from IllFonic and Gun Interactive along with Compass International Pictures and Further Front, Halloween will release in 2026 for PlayStation, Xbox, and PC.

“The Boogeyman is out,” the game’s description reads. “Team up in a 1v4 asymmetrical horror showdown on everyone’s favorite night of the year. Choose to save the quiet town of Haddonfield from bloodshed as a Hero of Haddonfield or stalk and terrorize the residents as Michael Myers.”

“Bringing this world to gamers everywhere is extremely exciting for the whole development team at IllFonic,” Jared Gerritzen, chief creative officer at IllFonic, said “We cannot wait to share more information as we work towards launch in 2026!”

John Carpenter, the director of the original film will serve as executive producer of the game. Also, the game will be both a single player and multiplayer experience, though it’s currently unknown how it will work for solo players.

More details on Halloween: The Game will be announced in the coming months.

item.title: Phantom Blade Zero Release Date Reveal Coming This Year
item.content:encoded:
After being in development for quite some time, Phantom Blade Zero will finally get a release date this year. The news comes from Future Games Show, which held a “Deep Dive” with the team. Alongside new gameplay, we got some new details on the combat and style.

Phantom Blade Zero follows an elite assassin tasked with finding the killer of The Order’s patriarch. It mixes the gameplay of Soulsborne titles and RPGs to craft an intricate combat system. Since its big reveal in 2023, fans have been hungry for more of the game, and Future Games Show delivered some promising news.

Phantom Blade Zero’s Release Date Announcement Happening Within The Year

In the deep dive at Future Games Show, director Soulframe Liang showed off new gameplay of Phantom Blade Zero. In addition, we saw cool new weapons, over 30 in fact, and wicked action combat. However, the most notable comment was about the game’s release. At the end of the presentation, Liang said that, before the year ends, we will know when the game will come out. Whether the date is concrete or a release window remains to be seen.

The game has been played by critics from various sites not too long ago back in July. For many, the wuxia-inspired combat system and stunning visuals left a positive mark. Following the success of other Chinese games like Black Myth: Wukong and Wuchang: Fallen Feathers, Phantom Blade Zero could be the next big one, if done right.

Are you looking forward to Phantom Blade Zero? Let us know in the comments and on the forums!
